website_summaries.verdict: The best budget mouse pad that doesn't trade build quality for value.
pros: Provides a clean, smooth surface for a value mouse pad
Surface cloth is easy to protect and clean to extend the pad's life
cons: Edges of the mouse pad can begin to rip after some heavy use

customer_reviews.title: These mouse pads stink - not that they are terrible as mouse pad, they just smell really bad.
customer_reviews.text: Size is right, lays nice and flat, texture is perfect but OMG the smell! I bought 3 of them and these things smell like concentrated ashtray or burning factory or maybe smouldering tire dump. Contaminates any tote bag we put them in. Makes any office smell like a smoker works there. If you are a chain smoker you won't notice a thing, this mouse pad will work great for you. If not, don't use them yourself, give them as gifts to your enemies. We have them outside on the porch with dryer sheets between them hoping this stench gasses off pretty quickly or they are going in the bin on the next trash day.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Williams

customer_reviews.title: Fabric is peeling away from rubber after two weeks of use.
customer_reviews.text: I only paid two bucks and it was an "add on" item, so I almost feel bad complaining, but this photo is what it looks like after only two weeks of use. The fabric is peeling away from the rubber. I'll probably only get a couple more weeks use out of it before it needs to be thrown away. Guess I'll just go back to what I was doing before and just use the back of my paper notepad.
customer_reviews.author: R. T.

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  It turned into a giant blue potato chip!
customer_reviews.text: I never got a chance to use it. I put it on my desk (still in the plastic wrap) by the window and returned 5-10 minutes later to find the pad looked like a big potato chip (warped) It didn't feel too warm so I placed the pad immediately under some books on a flat surface but it didn't help much. The pad is warped so much it is not usable. The surface must be a very temperature sensitive thermoplastic. I think it would be fine in a room without direct light and away from a direct heat source. I definitely would not recommend putting a hot cup of coffee on it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Plain and Simple Mousepad.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very reliable and basic mousepad. I only got this one with no graphics on it because all my other computer accessories are black too. It will last you a long time, but don't make the same mistake I did and use one corner as a coaster for your drink. Enough soda or even water mixed with the dust and dirt that can build on this mousepad will leave white watermarks that don't come out. My last one got so bad that I attempted to wash and then let it dry. I actually ruined it by doing so. The slick surface cloth peeled right off. Best black mousepad in any case. I Recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: JO-əl G

customer_reviews.title: Thick, flat and functional
customer_reviews.text: It's nice and thick with clean edges. A little on the firm side (not too cushy) but that's fine. No smell that I can detect. My wireless laser mouse tracks well, no stuttering, seems precise. The surface material is a tiny bit course, creating a little bit of drag as you move your mouse over it, but again it's very small. I have another mousepad that's thinner but smoother, and the mouse glides more easily. Not an issue though just mentioning in case you're picky about that. I would absolutely buy this item again.
customer_reviews.author: PlaysWellWithOthers

customer_reviews.title: Basic Mouse Pad - great for optical mice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse pad because it was the right size and material for me to cut in half. I use the half to protect the wood arms of my easy chair when I am using my laptop with a mouse. Yes, this pad stinks when first removed from the packaging, but it quickly off gasses and 24 hours later there is no noticeable odor. Sure, it still smells a little if you put it right up to your nose, but it's nothing you'll notice otherwise. There's no need to pay 10 bucks for a mouse pad when this one does just fine.
customer_reviews.author: BacchusGal

customer_reviews.title: Stinks
customer_reviews.text: All the mousepads had a very strong chemical odor from the package. This faded over time, but it took several days. These have a very smooth surface and seem to track well, but they are light and do not seem to grip the surface they are on. For what I paid, they are ok, but not what I would expect from Belkin.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey McCollough

customer_reviews.title: Great, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect simple small mousepad. I have a standing desk at work, and this fits on the lower ledge that I keep the keyboard and mouse on. It doesn't smell, as some of the earlier poor reviews stated. Its spongy, and the mouse glides over it smoothly. Rubber underside is keeping it from sliding my my prior pad. Probly won't think about it again for years, until it needs replacing. Low price meant I didn't have to wrangle with my IT dept over requisitioning one to replace their thin nylon cheapy.
customer_reviews.author: AJR

customer_reviews.title: Good little pad.
customer_reviews.text: I don't remember why I got a new pad... My other one was either showing its age or was too big for the area I keep my mouse. I purchased a big drawing tablet that takes up a lot of room and encroaches on where I use my mouse, so I needed a small pad. It's small and simple, and that's exactly what I wanted. The rubbery texture on the bottom keeps it in place, and the cloth texture on top lets my mouse move around without going crazy. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: SuketchiLT

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight but otherwise not bad for a $2 mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight but otherwise not bad for a $2 mouse pad. Except that this came packaged in the worst way possible, using the type you'd pack a book in. If it were the only item it would be fine. But there were two other odd sized items, and this was doubled over among them. So there's now a permanent crease in it, even when forced flat you can feel it through the mouse. One of those things that's not really worth dealing with. My primary aggravation comes in realizing there's someone that takes such little care with their job.
customer_reviews.author: M. Blanton

customer_reviews.title: Light blue: surface too slick.  Black: ohmygosh the stink!!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, this is one of those products with different color offerings, but the ratings all go to one place. The light blue one was way too smooth, felt like I was ice skating. The black one has the jersey surface I prefer, but the rubbery smell is strong almost to the point of nauseating. I'm editing my three stars to one, because neither one is what I wanted. If the smell diminishes I will edit and raise the stars, otherwise, I'm quite displeased.
customer_reviews.author: zgmcgee

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Not even worth the $3.95 I paid for it! It is very thin, weighs next to nothing, and the surface is not smooth so is noticeably noisy when moving the mouse around. I previously bought the "Belkin Standard 8-Inch by 9-Inch Computer Mouse Pad with Neoprene Backing and Jersey Surface (Black) (F8E089-BLK)". It is thicker, more substantial and quieter but after three months of daily use the surface is seriously worn! Apparently it is no longer possible to buy quality mouse mats like in the old days!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: For a cheap solution it works
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad is really for use in a place that is quite clean. It does pick up dirt fast!! The cloth also starts to let go of the bottom foam piece fairly quick (a few months). Reflecting back on the price of this mouse pad, I am giving it 3 stars for it was a good bang for the buck. Biggest down sides are, almost impossible to clean, and the durability is fairly low in total (last about a year). Again at this price, it makes a GREAT backup/keep in your laptop case mouse pad that wont hurt your feelings if it goes south.
customer_reviews.author: RedR

customer_reviews.title: Not much of a mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. I paid 3 dollars and I got 3 dollars worth. It is hard and the mouse slides across the pad to easily making it hard to stop on an icon. I got mad and slammed the mouse on the pad and it cracked. If you want a good mouse pad, don't buy this junk. I buy Logitech products all the time and they are durable and last a long time. This is an exception. They really should not even offer this.
customer_reviews.author: Guadelupe Fineburg

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE smell
customer_reviews.text: Writing 1 star not because it doesn't work- but because it reaks and the current ratings are deceitful. I purchased this mouse in a hurry- it was well rated (4/5 stars) and had thousands of purchases. I wish I would have stopped for ONE MINUTE to read reviews... the new smell is HORRIBLE. Gives me a headache. It still reaks, but then again, I've only had it for a day. I'm gonna have to try washing it and see if that helps. I hope more people giving a one star can help bring it does to 3 stars or something where buyers can tell something might be off...
customer_reviews.author: KTF

customer_reviews.title: Using for eight years now
customer_reviews.text: As I was reviewing my recent purchases, I saw this in my review list. I can't believe I've been using this for over eight years now. The blue cloth surface on the bottom left and top right corners are coming off a little and the surface has become a little dirty, but what do you expect after eight years of near daily use? The mat still grips well on the table top. If I buy another mouse pad, which is unlikely considering how will this has held up, it'll be this.
customer_reviews.author: Yasir Malik

customer_reviews.title: Alternate Usage
customer_reviews.text: I use this very standard mouse pad as a sound preventer on a storage shelf on the dash of my automobile. I purchased it for that purpose. Just fits in the space and keeps our glasses from sliding around and rattling together. As to it's designed purpose, it would certainly fit the bill for a mouse pad. Standard depth, width and height. Acceptable quality for that purpose as well.
customer_reviews.author: ETNFOLIAGELOVER

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap mousepad
customer_reviews.text: Working from home. Needed a mousepad so my cursor would stop skipping. This worked great and was reasonably priced (~$6). If you're lucky, you'll get one like me that was a real blast from the past - mine was straight out of the year 2000, packaging and all. A fun experience for a useful product, haha! Overall I'd recommend. Blessings!
customer_reviews.author: A Branch

customer_reviews.title: perfect mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: i bought two of these forever ago and still use them to this day. they really last a long time with daily. the only downside to these is that they hold dust a bit so youll notice the color wear. also, the edges wear down over time as well. but the overall use of the pads remain intact and usable. ive been satisfied with these since the day i got them, over a year ago. would recommend these 100% if youre looking for something simple and cost friendly.
customer_reviews.author: zluv

customer_reviews.title: Mouse has difficult time capturing dpi on this smooth, solid color surface
customer_reviews.text: I bought because it was cheap, but now I realize that depending on what mouse you have, this mousepad can be an irritating experience to use your computer with mainly because of how it is one color with no textures so the mouse can't recognize it it has moved or not. My mouse is slightly laggy because of the surface of the belkin mousepad and I hope that belkin can make a mousepad that isn't a solid color, like what 3M has.
customer_reviews.author: Anson Dao

customer_reviews.title: Fine for basic mouse pad needs
customer_reviews.text: It’s a basic mouse pad, nothing special about it really. The material is about what you’d expect, and it doesn’t skid around too much. Wish it were a bit larger but it’s fine if you need a very basic mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: Ciceronian

customer_reviews.title: Fairly Thick - Minor Odor
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this one hoping would be a little thicker than the last one (different brand - my guess is a WM cheapie) - and it is fairly thick - around 1/2 cm per my ruler. Feels like the same padding as the thinner one - just sits a tiny bit higher and has more weight. Has a little odor that is more noticeable because of my underdesk drawer setup - would probably been fine on a desktop.
customer_reviews.author: West Coast Dreamer

customer_reviews.title: Mousepad is fine but it smells disgusting and stinks up the entire office!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I thought it was the sellers fault at first. It is like they were stored in a house full of smokers. When I first received these, the smell was incredible. I thought someone hid a wet, nasty ash tray in my office but it was the mouse pads. I ordered 4 of them. Yes ... the smell does go away at some point, at least the totally obnoxious overwhelming smell. But if you get close, it still reeks after 2 months of use. Co-workers notice the smell and actually complain about it. I am trying to air one out and see what happens but I am returning the other three. Totally gross.
customer_reviews.author: R Daneel

customer_reviews.title: Will not work with a wireless mouse
customer_reviews.text: I have used 3 different mouse pads and like this one my mouse will not track on them. Funny that when I flipped the pad over the mouse would track better, but movement was choppy due to the nature of the gripper surface. My mouse tracks just fine on black vinyl or a magazine cover or any dark colored surface, but not a mouse pad...
customer_reviews.author: Handyman247 LLC

customer_reviews.title: Hard plastic - don't buy
customer_reviews.text: DON'T BUY!! Hard plastic-like surface; mouse slips & curser skips. descriptions - reads "durable jersey surface" which is a fabric, not hard plastic. After I recd it, re-read prod desc & again reads jersey surface, but in another section reads different - neoprene, I think. This product is not good.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse Pad - Strong Scent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my aging, disgusting mouse pad I've been using for several years. Pros: Thickness - The pad is about 3/16" thick. It's a nice comfy height and feels a little more 'squishy' than my previous It's really black - Like totally black. So black. I like black. Cons: Smells like Thors thong. Seriously. I opened the bag and my apartment just began to ooze eau de Thor Thong. I let it air out for a couple days and now it only makes my wrist smell when I use it. Conclusion - Great mouse pad, strong scent. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: My wirelessmouse barely works on the pad....
customer_reviews.text: I literally had to put a sheet of paper on top to get the mouse to work correctly on this. DUNNO IF THE red throws off the laser or what but with my mouse it is basically useless...if you get one don't get red.....
customer_reviews.author: Bart&Amanda

customer_reviews.title: This may solve your optical mouse problems
customer_reviews.text: I had struggled for years with poor mouse performance without having any idea why until I bought this baby as an add-on ($1.88) to reach free shipping. I love it as much as the writers of the most favorable reviews. The mouse glides easily, without skipping or glitches as before and all its functions work just fine except one: when playing "Minesweeper" the mouse did not reliably open adjacent squares when depressed. After a day of use it seems to be doing so, so there may be a puzzling "breaking in" period. There noxious plastic smell that reviews from 2012 complained of is no longer present.
customer_reviews.author: Penelope

customer_reviews.title: Would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Overall the mouse pad is really nice. I like the thickness of it and how it cushions my hand while I'm using it. The smell that people are complaining about really isn't that strong and you only really smell it if you put the pad right up to your face. Which if you're putting mouse pads that close to your face regularly, then you have other things you need to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: Humza

customer_reviews.title: It's a mouse pad. It does mouse pad things. I like it.
customer_reviews.text: MX 518 died and bought a G502 to replace it. My old mouse pad was one of the hard types and the "grip" that held it onto the desk wore away after 10+ years of use so I decided to ditch it. Wanted something cheap in case I didn't like it. Got this guy and am more than happy. Am looking into getting one of the larger ones that also goes under the keyboard but for the time being in my limited desk space, this is more than enough for now.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Stinky Mouse Pad, Smell Won't Come Off
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad was such as terrible buy. The item smells so bad upon opening it. When I opened the package, the mouse pad smelled so much like vomit and I almost puked. It stinks, and nothing you do can wash the smell out. I've tried cleaning, rinsing, then throwing it into the dryer with dryer sheets, and even a heavy dosage of Febreeze. Upon touching the item, your hands will stink and everything it touches it will smell like vomit. DON'T BUY THIS. Spend $3 more and get a mousepad that won't stink,
customer_reviews.author: john a

customer_reviews.title: It's a mouse pad - it's gray - it works ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a mouse pad - it's gray - it works. I only gave it 4 stars because it's already starting to seperate on the end where my hand rests. But that happens to all this type mouse pad eventually. Boy do I miss the days when computer companies used to give mouse pads, with advertising, away for free. Used to have a drawer full of them - now I have to buy them :-(.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ray

customer_reviews.title: A Good, Basic Pad That's Slightly Oversized - A Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: It's your basic mouse pad...just a little longer! Nice quality, good thickness and the typical fabric top you see on most budget-oriented mouse pads. However, this model is about an inch longer than the popular "Fellowes" style pad, which I like. Beyond that, it's a solid mouse pad at a very good price and performs great for daily use! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Masta' C

customer_reviews.title: Solid Mousepad
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for a short time now with my Apple Magic Mouse 2, and I have no issues. Other reviews seemed to say it works terribly with an Apple Mouse in particular, but I haven't experienced this at all. Really works fine for me. I cannot vouch for any other mice at the moment. It does have a pungent smell right out of the bag, as if I'm in a car tire showroom, but it's not so bad, and I'm sure it'll wear off soon enough anyways. What I wanted was a fresh new mousepad and this is exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Klinefelter

customer_reviews.title: No odor, durable, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I remember some of the reviews said there was an odor. I've honestly had no issues with this mousepad and it travels well in my computer bag. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J_Mech

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awful!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this mouse pad for less than a week and I'm already looking to replace it. The top surface is hard plastic and is so slick that it's very difficult to hold the mouse steady when clicking. What I was really looking for was an "old style" mouse pad made out of thick foam with a cloth top - I believe that in the past they were made out of scuba divers wetsuit material. This is totally unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: E. David Gamble

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap product
customer_reviews.text: This mousepad is probably the thinnest, most poorly made item I've ever purchased. I realize you get what you pay for, but after only three days of normal use, the edges started to curl up on all sides. It won't stay in one place, so you have to constantly readjust its position on your desk, so I finally tossed it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: @Estuar1

customer_reviews.title: Great mousepad for the price and function!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite mouse pads for the price and functionality. Even though most mice that are sold these days do not need mousepads, I prefer to use a mousepad since it is easier to use a mouse with a mousepad because it glides much easier. I buy these mousepads for my entire office and will continue buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wasserman

customer_reviews.title: Horrid Smell. Be careful where you place it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mousepad for a wireless set up in my living room, and I made the mistake of placing it on my couch. The smell/chemicals/whatever have soaked into the arm of my couch. Febreeze hasn't helped. I tried washing soap and air drying it. After air-drying it's a little bit more tolerable but the smell is still there. I would say it went from a 10 (where the smell would be left on your hand) to a 6. I didn't bother using it again for anything. I just threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S

customer_reviews.title: Is cheap, feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: This may be one of the worst feeling and sounding mouse pads ever. I didn't even know mouse pads could be bad, I thought they were all just...mouse pads. The sound my mouse makes going over it is like running your mouse over asphalt. It technically does it's job but it sounds so bad and feels so cheap. The top layer isn't some cloth, it's a hard plastic coating. Again, I didn't know a mouse pad could be LOUD. It's amazing how bad this is. If you need a mouse and only have $3 to spend, buy this one. If you can somehow afford to buy something that's $10 -- please do that.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: New use for old product-just WONDERFUL!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so i am using these in a totally different way! These make a great pad to put under the sewing machine foot-the thing that makes the machine go! I have purchased a foot mat for $$ from a special quilting magazine-no names please! But really not much good. So for 2 bucks, these are wonderful, preventing the foot from sliding across the carpet or hardwood floor! I've had one under my machine for about a month, and it is still working!
customer_reviews.author: Babs

customer_reviews.title: I love these cheap mouse pads
customer_reviews.text: I love these cheap mouse pads, I typically buy one and use it for several years before I have to retire it. They just work, nothing fancy just simple and effective and this is coming from a guy with one of those expensive gaming mice. This has no tracking issues, glides well, and feels good to have my hand rest on. It's a great mouse pad, I can't understand why I want a more expensive one when these do such a great job.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son's mouse, this mouse pad seemed of good quality and he hasn't complained yet. When we purchased his computer it came with a mouse but no mouse pad so we just used it without one and ended up breaking the mouse in a few days so now that we have replaced the mouse we use this mouse pad and it seems to work great. It doesn't slide when used and seems to let the mouse move easily in use.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Much better!!
customer_reviews.text: My old mouse pad was beat up and difficult to keep clean, ordered the Belkin mouse pad and it has a jersey surface that is so much easier to clean. Highly recommend this product to those looking to replace an old, beat up mouse pad!!
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: It's A Mouse Pad
customer_reviews.text: If you keep it clean, and clean your oily hands before using the mouse it will last. Very cheaply priced. Still holding up from 2010. If you want something fancy you're looking at the wrong item. This works as you would expect.
customer_reviews.author: Ish Wish Dish

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Sailing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse pad specifically for the smooth surface, and it works great. If you get annoyed by mouse pad surfaces that become tacky dirt magnets, this one will solve your problem. Plus it's a three-pack, making a great value!
customer_reviews.author: Rickshore

customer_reviews.title: It smells so bad, I can't use it. And to make it worse, if you buy it, you cannot return it.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad smells toxic. I even left it in the garage for three days to air-out and it still smells. And the smell makes you feel sick. I tried to return it and was told they would not accept a return. DO NOT BUY THIS, THE SMELL IS AWFUL.
customer_reviews.author: Dan K

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Nice solid mousepad that is sturdy. With the optical mice nowadays, the surface material the mouse is on makes a huge difference in their performance. In my case, I was using my mouse on a white plastic long table, and my optical mice were having trouble picking up movement on that surface. This mousepad worked great to give me a much better surface to have my mouse on. It's just the right thickness. Thick enough to stay in place (especially with the rubber bottom), but not too thick to get in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Cool

customer_reviews.title: Simple mousepad, good value on sale
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple mousepad, I picked it up when it was on sale for two dollars. After about 1.5 months of use, it is holding up quite well. One edge is flipping up a bit, but that's mostly my fault because I'm pushing the keyboard against it. The other three edges are not getting this treatment, and they don't have this issue. The real world measurement matches the description, it is about 8x10 inches. It feels good on the hands and the mouse, and does not have a smell after 1.5 months (I don't recall if there was a smell when it was brand new). It has minimal packaging, which is nice to the planet.
customer_reviews.author: bsg2004

customer_reviews.title: Great mousepad. Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Solid mousepad. Works well with my optical mouse. Should've gotten a bigger size because I have a 17" laptop, but not the pad's fault. I got a graphics tablet a few days after the mousepad, so my mouse is now retired (even for word processing) and the mousepad is now fulfilling the rest of its destiny as a protective cover for the tablet's surface while in my bag's other compartment :-) The suspect plastic pack with suspect rough-cardboard-back label saying "Belkin" in a suspect font do lead me to consider that this might not, in fact, be a genuine Belkin pad, but who cares? It's a good mousepad.
customer_reviews.author: vnikyt

customer_reviews.title: Fades easily
customer_reviews.text: I have this mouse pad for a few month and it is already faded where my palm is. Granted, because of working from home, I use this 9 hours a day. Despite the fading, it still holds up alright after several months of daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dinken

customer_reviews.title: Strong chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: This item mouse pad have a strong chemical smell it made me nauseous I would not purchase and I can’t return it which is a double whammy.
customer_reviews.author: Rey Mayoral

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This is vastly superior to the 'fabric' pads that I have tried. It will curl a little but after using if for awhile it is still in great shape. If you are tired to fabric pads whose corners curl up then this is the mouse pad for you!
customer_reviews.author: bleach

customer_reviews.title: Very bad
customer_reviews.text: A piece of cardboard would do a better job. Horrible mouse pad. Not rubberized at all
customer_reviews.author: JapillaTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Not latex free
customer_reviews.text: Says that the bottom is neoprene, which is a synthetic rubber. It is not. I had an almost immediate reaction to the neoprene which goes ups the sides of the mouse pad. So if you have a latex allergy, do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too light
customer_reviews.text: This thing s*cks, it's too light, won't stay put on the desk. Probably the worst mousepad I've ever encountered, not even worth 2 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Stinks
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the reviews rather than relying on the name "Belkin." Both pads have a strong chemical smell that has persisted for days. The odor gets on my hand and on the mouse. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Zork

customer_reviews.title: Nice mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: I really like this full-sized mouse pad. It Washes easily and works great for gaming. It didn't cost much either which is also a plus since this mouse pad looks and is just as comfortable as the more expensive ones.
customer_reviews.author: Ava Porter

customer_reviews.title: Horrible smell!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible SMELL! couldn't figure out what this smell was that smells like moth balls and bad breath. It was the mouse pads. Bought 2 of them. Smelled up the office. Ridiculous. You can't smell that when you are manufacturing these things? Must be made with all kinds of crazy chemicals. Threw them away. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Hinson

customer_reviews.title: Plays Well With Optical Mice
customer_reviews.text: Theis the first mouse pad I have purchased in a decade or so, and it is the only one I have ever had that actually worked well with optical mice. Occasionally, it will not track correctly, and I have to give the mouse an extra nudge, but so far this has been a rare occurrence. The only problem I have had was that the mouse pad reeked of chemicals (the rubber bottom?) when I removed it from the box, but that has almost entirely dissipated. If I put my nose next to it I can still detect the smell, though. Someone with a sensitive nose might be bothered.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Stinks
customer_reviews.text: This smells so badly like chemicals that it gets on my hand and lingers for hours. I thought it would dissipate over time, but its been 2 weeks and it still stinks. Going to have to order another and toss this one out.
customer_reviews.author: TheSpek

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse Pad
customer_reviews.text: Glad I found these again. I had bought a couple years ago and they have been great! Non-cloth mouse pads are very hard to find for some reason. I like them because they are easy to wipe clean.
customer_reviews.author: D.W.

customer_reviews.title: These are like the better mouse pads of yesteryear
customer_reviews.text: As simple as these things are, they are EXCEPTIONAL. I haven't seen a decent mouse pad in a store in 7-8 years, and they are usually paper thin, and $8-$12. These are like the better mouse pads of yesteryear, thicker, better performance, they don't wrinkle up like cheap tissue paper. HIGHLY recommended.
customer_reviews.author: AyeAyeCapn

customer_reviews.title: I can pack it easily into my laptop bag to bring with me if ...
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad is inexpensive and does exactly what it needs to. I can pack it easily into my laptop bag to bring with me if I need to and I can place it on a variety of surfaces depending on where I am. One example is that I was recently at a friend's house and only had the armchair of their sofa to put it on, I was just quickly using my laptop but because it's soft and flexible the mouse pad worked great even on that uneven surface. My mouse moves smoothly over it and I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Mehhhh
customer_reviews.text: It’s okay. It was cheap. Feels cheap. Very light. Doesn’t stick as good as other ones at target for $8.00. Slides around. Hated it. Trashed it. Bought the target one and should have in the first place
customer_reviews.author: Jake K

customer_reviews.title: Thicker Mouse Pad than Most
customer_reviews.text: This Belkin 8x9 inch mouse pad arrived quickly. It's as advertised, with a smooth nylon surface that tracks my mouse well. And it's nicely thick - it measures 5 mm (0.19 inches). I can't imagine a better mouse pad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bookster

customer_reviews.title: slipping and a sliding
customer_reviews.text: it's a little bigger than my old one. Stay put. But the mouse slides too far anf too fast. That you can get used to and adjust. However is moves if your heartbeat is too srtong, and if you press a button, it jumps off of whatever you were trying to hit on the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Edges Eventually Curled up. Try Something Else!
customer_reviews.text: Initially I liked this pad for it's price and it seemed decent. I gave it 4/5 stars. However, the pad soon started to curve up on the edges, eventually making it a little like a potato chip. This happened because a thin film is attached to the surface and it contracted while the foam below stayed the same. This is a fault in material choice. Moreover, I never liked the fact that it came smelling like a new tire. That's why I initially dinged it a point. The curled up edges, however, required that I subtract 3 more points. 1/5 stars. Please avoid, even if it is cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Bubbalicious

customer_reviews.title: Good enough. See you back here in 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't expect much out of a dirt cheap mousepad. I desperately needed one immediately and amazon was there overnight it to me. It is more comfortable than using a bare table surface and the mouse tracking performs much better with a real mousepad under it. I don't expect it to survive more than a year but I'll set myself a reminder and come back and update this review in exactly 6 months to see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Mouse tracking issues after a couple years of use (fixable)
customer_reviews.text: Paid very little for it so I have no real complaints. Would be nice if the grip on the bottom were a bit better (pad slides when I bump the side of it with my wrist). UPDATE: After a couple of years of use, the pad loses its texture - it becomes shiny and this results in serious optical mouse tracking issues. If you take the pad outside and rub its surface on concrete to create a bunch of scuffs, the pad will be usable again. The more scuffs the better. Don't forget to wipe the dirt off the surface afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Artree

customer_reviews.title: Standard Neoprene Mouse Pad With No Frills
customer_reviews.text: I have a glass-top desk, so a mouse pad is a must. This mouse pad provides a nice flat surface for movement and a surface the optical sensor can track on. You might want one a bit bigger for gaming or computer graphics work, but this is good for most purposes. The cloth surface picks up dirt a little too readily, but it's a sacrifice I'm willing to make for noise and comfort over a hard-surfaced mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S

customer_reviews.title: Is exactly what you'd expect
customer_reviews.text: No surprises here. It is a rubber pad with a fabric top that appears to be glued down, like every mousepad you've ever seen in your life. Functions adequately. No frills, plain black with no logo or design. Dimensions are accurate in the description, cheap and functional.
customer_reviews.author: jacob m

customer_reviews.title: Great Standard Mousepad
customer_reviews.text: As someone of a gaming enthusiast, typically people like me get the fancy mousepads that you need to plugin or are made of aluminum. I don't really do that. As far as regular mousepads go, this one is perfect. Its surface is smooth and provides laser mice a lot of accuracy. It's thick, it's heavy, and it grips really well on my desk making it perfect. Good design is not something you notice, it's like good special effects in movies. If the company did its job then you won't ever notice it's there. You won't ever notice this mousepad on your desk because it's unobtrusive, well-made, and does exactly what it's meant to do.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Tracks worse than the bare table with a red optical mouse
customer_reviews.text: The surface is nice and slick, and the back sticks to the desk nicely. It tracks well with my Microsoft Blue-track mouse, but my standard red optical Amazon Basics wireless mouse doesn't track well at all on it. I have a feeling the color is incompatible with a standard red optical mouse. My other complaint is that the pad generates a large amount of static, which is not desirable around electronic devices such as computers.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Loper

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: These make a nice cushion for the mouse and doesn't cause 'mouse confusion', like a graphic printed pad can. I don't buy expensive mouse pads anymore because they don't seem to last any longer than the inexpensive pads: for me anyway. This is my second purchased of these pads, for home use. They are good for the price. The only down side is that the fabric surface eventually releases on the edges, do to our hands and arms bumping or rubbing over the edge; just like all the other pads I have had. This fabric does not curl up on me. So for less than $2, I can replace these pads every 3-4 years.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Eberly

customer_reviews.title: It stinks
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a nice thick mouse pad but I took off a star because it has a horrendous smell. I'm hoping that airing it out will take care of it before my son starts school.
customer_reviews.author: FMA

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad is pretty standard, but that's what makes it so great. Works well on my mouse and it's a good size. It hasn't fallen apart on me or anything just yet. It did have a strong smell for a few days, but it went away. It is a little thick, and it gets dirty like every other mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: A.I.

customer_reviews.title: Stinks and doesn't even work properly.
customer_reviews.text: This thing reeks. I thought the smell would go away after a few days, but it didn't. I then placed a bunch desicant packets on it with a small desk fan blowing on it and left it like that for a few more days. That still didn't get rid of the smell. There are also times where my mouse loses tracking on this mouse pad and randomly jerks the cursor around, which I have never encountered with any other mouse pad before. I'm planning on ordering an amazon basics pad on my next order. Hopefully the couple of extra dollars means I won't get a stinky piece of trash.
customer_reviews.author: Rayor

customer_reviews.title: this thing stinks, literally and figuratively
customer_reviews.text: This mousepad does not work well for optical mouses! I tried to use it with a great, reliable mouse and this pad caused it to act jumpy and inaccurate. It also smells awful!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: $2.50, not worth ordering; not worth sending back
customer_reviews.text: Totally the worst mousepad I have bought since the start of the DOS PC in 1982. Less useful than my granddaughters crayon scribbling on blank paper. I should have known better than to buy Belkin. Skip it. $2.50. Not worth ordering, not worth sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. McCoy

customer_reviews.title: It's a mousepad. I have had absolutely no problems ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a mousepad. I have had absolutely no problems with it whatsoever. I put it on my desk, put my mouse on it, and have used it daily for the last 6 months. It replaced another mousepad that had the top fabric layer peel away, but this mousepad has had no such problem. I've even rinsed it in the sink to clean it with zero problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse pad for daily use
customer_reviews.text: Good mouse pad. I do see lot of review comments about chemical/toxic smell but I have been using it for quite some time now and have not found any foul smell, I have red colored mouse pad. Pros: 1. Price 2. Good size 3. Durable - no issues whatsoever till now. 4. Mouse works well on it. Con: 1. it is an add-on item and cannot be shipped alone.
customer_reviews.author: vivek

customer_reviews.title: VERY rough and scratchy!
customer_reviews.text: The most abrasive mousepad surface I've seen in 20+ years of computer use. "Jersey finish" ? Hardly. Feels more like a nail file..using this for over an hour and your hand goes raw. What are they thinking? Surprised at Belkin.
customer_reviews.author: NYCreview

customer_reviews.title: Just a flimsy piece with hard plastic
customer_reviews.text: No point in buying this. It's no different than using a mousepad on a hard table or surface. Spend a few more bucks and get once with a soft antimicrobial surface
customer_reviews.author: MrMosheB

customer_reviews.title: cheaper than it's predecessor
customer_reviews.text: I've owned quite a few of these mouse pads in the past and they've been built solid and lasted years. Clearly, Belkin has cut corners with these newer pads. The top is still the same... provides the mouse (laser or ball style) excellent tracking.....not at all slippery or reflective at all. But the grip pad underneath is now made of a cheap/smooth black foam instead of thicker/heavy gel found on my older pads. The foam doesn't have the weight or coarseness to keep the pad totally level and firmly planted on the desk. Also, the bottom foam has a 'rubbery' odor that takes a few days to air out. In summary, the top is quality, the bottom is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Not "Premium"
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered bent. A premium mouse pad will allow you to unbend it back to flat. This does not. It's stuck bent, therefore unusable. This is NOT a premium mouse pad.
customer_reviews.author: Shannara

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for some black mouse-pads that didn't cost a fortune. Thought I would give these a try and I can't believe how nice they are for the money. They are very reasonably priced and couldn't be nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: I didn't think it could be that bad or figured it must be a bad batch since ...
customer_reviews.text: The smell of these things is unbelievable. I didn't think it could be that bad or figured it must be a bad batch since so many reviews are positive. I threw them in my washing machine three times to tone the smell down to tolerable, but now they are warped a bit. Prior to that, your hand would reek just from using the mouse for a few minutes, and if you had it in an even semi-enclosed room, the whole room would smell. It's truly unbelievably bad.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Thonus

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad is very secure. It stays in place and goes great with my new mouse. The pad is of the right thickness and is not flimsy. Would recommend buying this.
customer_reviews.author: K. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Don't
customer_reviews.text: lasted a few months, then the sheet started to peel off. Maybe I was rough with it? Maybe you get what you pay for? I don't know, but my life hasn't collapsed without a mouse pad, so I would not recommend this item at all
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Hall

customer_reviews.title: Mice love these
customer_reviews.text: My mouse loves this. He tried to chew on the corners of it, but didn’t seem to enjoy the taste so it worked out. The poop rolls right off of it so it’s really easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Mickie Rat

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Happy! I bought this to use at work
customer_reviews.text: Extremely Happy! I bought this to use at work. I am a graphic designer who lives on his computer and I use it every day. It has lasted 2 years and its starting to get a little worn around the edges. Also the pad is pretty slip proof. This is the perfect average every day mouse pad and I am very picky. It even has a clean simple design. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve V. Kurtas

customer_reviews.title: A mousepad that doesn't work???
customer_reviews.text: This pad stinks. Literally smells like burnt plastic. Aside form that, it doesn't work. It causes my mouse to stall continuously. I can't move the mouse more than 2 inches without the cursor stopping. I didn't realize there were no returns. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi H.

customer_reviews.title: Intoxicating smell - standard mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the smellyest thing ever in my house - this thing reeks of chemical smell. I've had it out of it's packaging outside for 4 days now. I brought it inside this morning and it's smelling up the living room like you wouldn't believe. We've got all the windows open too! I wonder what kind of product these use to make this? I would spring a few extra bucks for a higher priced, non stinky mouse pad. I'm going to try leaving it outside for another few days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too much friction for an optical mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: For a ball mouse this might be a good mouse, but for my optical mouse, which moves on skids, I found it to have far too much friction. My mouse works beautifully on the desktop. I just wanted something to protect the desk. This is definitely not it. Wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Works Just Fine
customer_reviews.text: I use a wireless mouse and the movement translates very well with this mousepad. I don't use it for gaming but for typical office type of work on a PC, it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K.

customer_reviews.title: Large pad, better than what I could find locally
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad is 1 inch longer, slightly thicker and costs less than the last one I bought at a local Staples. Only one type of pad was available in the local store. Will buy here again next time for the much better selection.
customer_reviews.author: MargaretNC

customer_reviews.title: Plain old mousepad, but my opticla mouse doesn't like it
customer_reviews.text: It's nothing special, just a normal mousepad. My mouse sometimes doesn't like it though and will act like it can't see it. It works better on the table top than the mousepad, but it was scratching the table. It's a minor irritation though.
customer_reviews.author: Sam D

customer_reviews.title: Its a mousepad
customer_reviews.text: Its a mousepad. It does what mousepads do. Im not a gamer besides those free online or whatever type of games lol. I like the size and color. Great cheap mousepad
customer_reviews.author: Kiarah

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse pad.
customer_reviews.text: Its a great cheap mouse pad. I will be getting a few years out of this for sure. I seen the reviews about people complaining about the smell, its not as bad as what some described. They were a bit over dramatic. Does it smell new? Yes. Will the smell be so overwhelming that you have to air out your house? No. If you don't want a new smelling mouse pad, shop on craigslist. It smells like a new mouse pad. Its heavy duty and very mobile, if your on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

product_meta.title: Belkin Standard 8-Inch by 9-Inch Computer Mouse Pad with Neoprene Backing and Jersey Surface (Black) (F8E089-BLK)
product_meta.description: Color:BlackThe Belkin Mouse Pad provides your mouse with a smooth surface, ensuring greater accuracy, control, and faster response. Our durable jersey surface and rubber non slip backing keep your mouse on track and performing at its best.
feature_bullets: Computer mouse pad ensures smoother mouse control and pinpoint accuracy
Provides a smooth surface for improved mouse tracking
Durable jersey surface provides excellent point and click precision
Nonslip neoprene base keeps mouse pad firmly in place
Available in a variety of attractive colors

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars8,922 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
